These compound words have hyphens between them.

- check-in
- check-out
- runner-up
- passer-by
- self-esteem
- self-service
- self-employed
- full-time
- part-time
- mother-in-law / father-in-law (rare in IELTS but useful to know)
- brother-in-law / sister-in-law
- son-in-law / daughter-in-law (plural: sons-in-law, not son-in-laws)
- passer-by
- editor-in-chief
- commander-in-chief
- well-known
- well-developed
- up-to-date
- state-of-the-art
- high-quality
- low-cost
- first-class
- long-term
- short-term
- user-friendly
- energy-efficient
- cost-effective
- stress-free
- hands-on
- time-consuming
- English-speaking (e.g., "an English-speaking country")
- part-time / full-time (when used as adjectives: "a part-time job")
- middle-aged
